meanings.definition: To allow passengers to board a vehicle or aircraft before the official boarding time.
meanings.sent1: The airline decided to preboard families with young children to make the process smoother.
meanings.sent2: Passengers who need extra assistance often preboard to find their seats comfortably.
meanings.sent3: The eager passengers joked that they would preboard even before the crew arrived!
meanings.sent4: The early birds always try to preboard, eager to claim the best seats.
meanings.sent5: The captain announced that they would preboard due to a slight delay in departure.

meanings.definition: The act of boarding a vehicle or aircraft before the official boarding time.
meanings.sent1: The preboard of the VIP guests was a smooth and efficient process.
meanings.sent2: Passengers who qualify for preboard often enjoy a more relaxed boarding experience.
meanings.sent3: The preboard of the first-class passengers caused envy among those waiting in line.
meanings.sent4: The preboard of the elderly passengers was a heartwarming sight for the crew.
meanings.sent5: The preboard of the flight attendants surprised the passengers, showing their dedication to service.
